a.g: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -

He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.
But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.
And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.
And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."
Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."
And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
SKIPPED_NOT_FOUND

a.g: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.
But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.
[They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."
Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.
For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.
And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"
They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."
So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.

And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فتلا قوله تعالى وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة أتصبرون ثم قال بلى أصبر وأرضى وكان فقيرا مقلا فالذي هو في بيته لا يبتلى بمثل هذه الفتن فإن من شاهد زينة الدنيا فإما أن يقوى دينه ويقينه فيصبر إلى أن يتجرع مرارة الصبر وهو أمر من الصبر أو تنبعث رغبته فيحتال في طلب الدنيا فيهلك هلاكا مؤبدا أما في الدنيا فبالطمع الذي يخيب في أكثر الأوقات فليس كل من يطلب الدنيا تتيسر له وأما في الآخرة فإيثاره متاع الدنيا على ذكر الله تعالى والتقرب إليه
Indeed, We have made some of you a trial [fitnah] for others: "Will you be patient?" Then he said, "Yes, I will be patient and be content," and he was poor and destitute. So the one who is in his home is not tested with a trial like this. For whoever witnesses the adornment [zīnah] of the world [dunyā], either his religion [dīn] and his certainty [yaqīn] will strengthen, so he will be patient until he swallows the bitterness of patience—and that is a command from patience—or his desire will surge, so he schemes in seeking the world [dunyā] and perishes an everlasting perishing. As for in the world [dunyā], then through covetousness [ṭamaʿ] which fails most of the time, for not everyone who seeks the world [dunyā] finds it made easy for him. And as for in the Hereafter [ākhirah], then through his preferring the enjoyment [matāʿ] of the world [dunyā] over the remembrance [dhikr] of God, the Exalted, and drawing near [taqarrub] to Him.

a.g: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "لقد استكبروا في أنفسهم وعتوا عتواً كبيراً" وذم الكبر في القرآن كثير وقد قال رسول الله ﷺ "لا يدخل الجنة من كان في قلبه مثقال حبة من خردل من كبر، ولا يدخل النار من كان في قلبه مثقال حبة من خردل من إيمان" وقال أبو هريرة رضي الله عنه: قال رسول الله ﷺ "يقول الله تعالى الكبرياء ردائي والعظمة إزاري فمن نازعني واحداً منهما ألقيته في جهنم ولا أبالي" وعن أبي سلمة بن عبد الرحمن قال: التقى عبد الله بن عمرو وعبد الله بن عمر على الصفا فتواقفا، فمضى ابن عمرو وأقام ابن عمر يبكي، فقالوا ما يبكيك يا أبا عبد الرحمن؟ فقال: هذا - يعني عبد الله بن عمرو - زعم أنه سمع رسول الله ﷺ يقول "من كان في قلبه مثقال حبة من خردل من كبر أكبه الله في النار على وجهه" وقال رسول الله ﷺ "لا يزال الرجل يذهب بنفسه حتى يكتب في الجبارين فيصيبه ما أصابهم من العذاب" وقال سليمان بن داود عليهما السلام يوماً -للطير والإنس والجن والبهائم: اخرجوا، فخرجوا في مائتي ألف من الإنس ومائتي ألف من الجن، فرفع حتى سمع زجل الملائكة بالتسبيح في السموات، ثم خفض حتى مست أقدامه البحر، فسمع صوتاً: لو كان في قلب صاحبكم مثقال ذرة من كبر لخسفت به أبعد مما رفعته. وقال ﷺ "يخرج من النار عنق له أذنان تسمعان وعينان تبصران ولسان ينطق يقول: وكلت بثلاثة: بكل جبار عنيد وبكل من دعا مع الله إلهاً آخر وبالمصورين" وقال ﷺ "لا يدخل الجنة بخيل ولا جبار ولا سيئ الملكة" وقال ﷺ "تحاجت الجنة والنار فقالت النار: أوثرت بالمتكبرين والمتجبرين، وقالت الجنة: ما لي لا يدخلني إلا ضعفاء الناس وسقاطهم وعجزتهم؟ فقال الله للجنة: إنما أنت رحمتي أرحم بك من أشاء من عبادي، وقال للنار: إنما أنت عذابي أعذب بك من أشاء ولكل واحدة منكما ملؤها" وقال ﷺ "بئس العبد عبد تجبر واعتدى ونسى الجبار"
Indeed, He, the Exalted, said: "They have grown arrogant [istakbaru] within themselves and have transgressed with great transgression [‘utuwan kabiran]." And the censure of arrogance [kibr] in the Qur'an is frequent. And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "He in whose heart [qalb] is an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr] will not enter Paradise, and he in whose heart [qalb] is an atom's weight of faith [iman] will not enter the Fire." And Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "God, the Exalted, says: 'Grandeur [al-kibriya'] is My cloak, and majesty [al-'azamah] is My garment. Whoever contends with Me for one of them, I will cast him into Hellfire, and I do not care.'" And from Abu Salamah ibn 'Abd al-Rahman, he said: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr and 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar met at al-Safa and stood together. Then Ibn 'Amr departed, and Ibn 'Umar remained weeping. They said: "What makes you weep, O Abu 'Abd al-Rahman?" He said: "This one – meaning 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr – claims he heard the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'Whoever has in his heart [qalb] an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr], God will cast him into the Fire upon his face.'" And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man continues to exalt himself until he is recorded among the tyrants [al-jabbarin], and then befalls him what befell them of punishment." And Solomon, son of David, peace be upon them both, said one day – to the birds, mankind, jinn, and beasts: "Come forth," and they came forth: two hundred thousand from mankind and two hundred thousand from the jinn. He was raised until he heard the clamor of the angels glorifying in the heavens, then he was lowered until his feet touched the sea. He heard a voice: "If there were in the heart [qalb] of your companion an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr], I would have caused the earth to swallow him from a distance greater than I have raised him." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will emerge from the Fire a neck having two ears that hear, two eyes that see, and a tongue that speaks. It will say: 'I have been entrusted with three: with every obstinate tyrant [jabbar 'anid], with everyone who calls upon another god alongside God, and with the image-makers.'" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The miser, the tyrant [al-jabbar], and he of bad character will not enter Paradise." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Paradise and the Fire argued. The Fire said: 'I have been favored with the arrogant [al-mutakabbirin] and the tyrants [al-mutajabbirin].' And Paradise said: 'What is wrong with me that none enter me except the weak, the lowly, and the incapable among the people?' God said to Paradise: 'You are but My mercy [rahmati]; I show mercy through you to whom I will of My servants.' And He said to the Fire: 'You are but My punishment ['adhabi]; I punish through you whom I will. And for each of you is its full measure.'" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "How evil is the servant who acts tyrannically [tajabbar] and transgresses and forgets the All-Compelling [al-Jabbar]."

a.g: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."
And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد قال الله تعالى في كل عمل كان بإرادة غير الله مشوبا مغمورا وقدمنا إلى ما عملوا من عمل فجعلناه هباء منثورا
Indeed, We shall proceed to what they have done of deeds [a'mal], and We shall render them as scattered dust [haba'an manthura].

a.g: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.
And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكذلك سمع مرة قوله تعالى الملك يومئذ الحق للرحمن فاضطرب فسأله ابن سالم وكان من أصحابه فقال قد ضعفت فقيل له فإن كان هذا من مضعف فما قوة الحال فقال أن لا يرد عليه وارد إلا وهو يلتقيه بقوة حاله فلا تغيره الواردات وإن كانت قوية وسبب القدرة على ضبط الظاهر مع وجود الوجد استواء الأحوال بملازمة الشهود كما حكي عن سهل رحمه الله تعالى أنه قال حالتي قبل الصلاة وبعدها واحدة لأنه كان مراعيا للقلب حاضر الذكر مع الله تعالى في كل حال فكذلك يكون قبل السماع وبعده إذ يكون وجده دائما وعطشه متصلا وشربه مستمرا بحيث لا يؤثر السماع في زيادته.
Indeed, likewise, it was heard that upon hearing the Words of the Almighty, "The Sovereignty [al-mulk] on that Day will be the True [al-haqq] for the Most Merciful [al-Rahman]," he trembled [fad-tarab]. Ibn Salim, who was among his companions, asked him, and he said, "I have weakened [da'uftu]." It was said to him, "If this is from a state of weakness, then what is the strength of the state [quwwat al-hal]?" He said, "That no incoming thought [warid] comes upon him except that he meets it with the strength of his state [quwwat halihi], so the incoming thoughts [al-waridat] do not change him, even if they are powerful. And the cause of the ability to control the outward [zahir] while the spiritual state [wajd] is present is the equilibrium of states [istiwa' al-ahwal] through constant witnessing [mulazamat al-shuhud]. As it is narrated from Sahl, may Allah have mercy upon him, that he said, 'My state [halati] before the prayer and after it is one,' because he was guarding the heart [qalb], present in remembrance [dhikr] with Allah, the Exalted, in every state. So likewise, it is before the audition [sama'] and after it, for his spiritual state [wajduhu] is constant, his thirst [atashuhu] is continuous, and his drinking [shurbuhu] is uninterrupted, such that the audition [al-sama'] does not affect an increase in it."

a.g: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.
Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."
And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."
And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.
And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.
And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.
And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.
And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.
And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.
And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.
And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.
Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولذلك قال الله تعالى: " أرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه " وقال ﭬ: " أبغض إله عبد في الأرض الهوى " ولذلك قال عليه السلام: " من قال لا إله إلا الله مخلصاً دخل الجنة" ومعنى الإخلاص أن يخلص قلبه لله فلا يبقى فيه شرك لغير الله، فيكون الله محبوب قلبه ومعبود قلبه ومقصود قلبه فقط.
Indeed, every beloved [mahbub] is an object of worship [ma'bud], for the servant [al-'abd] is the one who is bound, and the object of worship [al-ma'bud] is that by which he is bound, and every lover [muhibb] is bound by what he loves. And for this reason, Allah, the Exalted, said: "Have you seen the one who takes his desire [hawahu] as his god [ilahahu]?" And He said: "The most hated god [abghad ilah] a servant worships on earth is desire [al-hawa]." And for this reason, the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever says 'There is no god but Allah' with sincerity [mukhlisan] enters Paradise." And the meaning of sincerity [al-ikhlas] is that his heart [qalbuhu] is made sincere for Allah, so that no association [shirk] for other than Allah remains within it. Thus, Allah becomes the beloved [mahbub] of his heart [qalbihi], the object of worship [ma'bud] of his heart [qalbihi], and the sole aim [maqsud] of his heart [qalbihi].

a.g: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن الطريق إلى الله تعالى مراقبة الأوقات وعمارتها بالأوراد على سبيل الدوام، ولذلك قال النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم: (أحب عباد الله إلى الله الذين يراعون الشمس والقمر والأظلة لذكر الله تعالى). فلا تظنن أن المقصود من سير الشمس والقمر بحسبان منظوم مرتب ومن خلق الظل والنور والنجوم أن يستعان بها على أمور الدنيا، بل لتعرف بها مقادير الأوقات فتشتغل فيها بالطاعات والتجارة للدار الآخرة. يدلك على ذلك قوله تعالى: ﴿ألم تر إلى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شاء لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا ثم قبضناه إلينا قبضا يسيرا﴾، فإن الظل يمتد ويتقلص بإرادة الله، والشمس دليل على توقيت الأوقات للذكر والعبادة، وقبضه يسيراً إظهار لقدرة الله في التحول من ظل الليل إلى نور النهار، فيجب أن يكون ذلك باعثاً على مراعاة الأوقات للتقرب إلى الله بالطاعات.
Indeed, the path [tariq] to God, exalted is He, is the vigilant observance [muraqaba] of times and their cultivation through regular devotional acts [awrad] in a manner of constancy. And for this reason, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The most beloved of God's servants to God are those who observe the sun and the moon and the shadows for the remembrance [dhikr] of God, exalted is He." So do not suppose that the purpose of the course of the sun and the moon according to a precise, ordered system, and of the creation of shadow and light and the stars, is that they be used as aids for the affairs of the world [dunya]. Rather, it is so that you may know by them the measures of times, and thus occupy yourself within them with acts of obedience [ta'at] and commerce for the Abode of the Hereafter [dar al-akhira]. This is indicated to you by His saying, exalted is He: "Have you not considered your Lord—how He extends the shadow? If He willed, He could have made it still. Then We made the sun for it a guide. Then We withdraw it to Us, a gentle withdrawal." For the shadow extends and contracts by the will of God, and the sun is a guide for the timing of periods for remembrance [dhikr] and worship ['ibada]. And His withdrawing it gently is a manifestation of God's power in the transformation from the shadow of night to the light [nur] of day. Thus, this must be an incentive for the vigilant observance of times, to draw near to God through acts of obedience [ta'at].

a.g: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن شرف الوقت بين طلوع الصبح وطلوع الشمس يظهر في إقسام الله تعالى به وتمجيده، إذ هو وقت قبض الظل ببسط النور، كما قال تعالى: ﴿ ثم قبضناه إلينا قبضا يسيرا ﴾، فيدل ذلك على قدرة الله في إزالة ظلمة الليل بنور الصباح، ليوقظ القلوب للذكر والتسبيح، فيشغل المؤمن هذا الوقت بالطاعات تجارة للآخرة.
Indeed, the nobility [sharaf] of the time between the dawn's emergence and the sun's rising is made manifest in God the Exalted's swearing by it and glorifying it, for it is the time of gathering the shadow [zill] by the spreading of the light [nur], just as He the Exalted said: "Then We withdraw it to Us, a gradual withdrawal." This indicates the power [qudrah] of God in removing the darkness [zulmah] of the night with the light [nur] of the morning, to awaken the hearts [qulub] for remembrance [dhikr] and glorification, so the believer occupies this time with acts of obedience [ta'at] as a trade for the Hereafter [al-akhirah].

a.g: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.
And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water
That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.
So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.
And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومن بدائع ألطافه أن خلق من الماء بشرا فجعله نسبا وصهرا وسلط على الخلق شهوة اضطرهم بها الحراثة جبرا واستبقى بهم نسلهم إقهارا وقسرا ثم عظم أمر الأنساب وجعل لها قدرا فحرم بسببها السفاح وبالغ في تقبيحه ردعا وزجرا وجعل اقتحامه جريمة فاحشة وأمر إمرا وندب إلى النكاح وحث عليه استحبابا وأمرا فسبحان من كتب الموت على عباده فأذلهم به هدما وكسرا ثم بث بذور النطف في أراضي الأرحام وأنشأ منها خلقا وجعله لكسر الموت جبرا تنبيها على أن بحار المقادير فياضة على العالمين نفعا وضرا وخيرا وشرا وعسرا ويسرا وطيا ونشرا
And from the wonders of His subtle graces [lata'if] is that He created from water a human being, then made him kinship [nasab] and affinity [sihr], and empowered over creation a desire [shahwa] which compelled them to cultivation by force, and preserved through them their progeny by overpowering and coercion. Then He magnified the affair of kinship ties [al-ansab] and gave them a measure, so He forbade because of them illicit intercourse [sifah], and was excessive in making it repugnant as a deterrent and a restraint, and made its commission a foul crime and a grave matter. And He enjoined marriage [nikah] and urged towards it as a recommendation and a command. So glory be to the One who decreed death upon His servants, thus humbling them through it by destruction and breaking, then He scattered the seeds of the drops [nutaf] in the soils of the wombs, and brought forth from them a creation, and made it, for the breaking of death, a restoration—as an indication that the seas of divine decrees [maqadir] are overflowing upon all worlds with benefit and harm, and good and evil, and hardship and ease, and folding and unfolding.

a.g: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وَقَرَأَ الْخَوَاصُّ قَوْلَهُ تَعَالَى: " وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْحَيِّ الَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ " إِلَى آخِرَ، فَقَالَ: مَا يَنْبَغِي لِلْعَبْدِ بَعْدَ هَذِهِ الْآيَةِ أَنْ يَلْجَأَ إِلَى أَحَدٍ غَيْرِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى.
And recite the special ones [al-khawass] His saying, the Exalted: "And rely upon the Ever-Living [al-Hayy] who does not die" to its end, and say: It is not fitting for the servant [al-'abd] after this verse that he should resort to anyone other than Allah, the Exalted.

a.g: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.
And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
﴿ تبارك الذي جعل في السماء بروجا وجعل فيها سراجا وقمرا منيرا ﴾ {} وإذا سمعت صوت الرعد فقل سبحان من يسبح الرعد بحمده والملائكة من خيفته
Blessed is He who placed constellations [buruj] in the heaven and placed therein a lamp [siraj] and a luminous moon [qamar munir]. And when you hear the sound of the thunder, say: "Glory be to Him whom the thunder glorifies with His praise, and the angels [mala'ika] from awe [khashya] of Him."

a.g: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن الله تعالى جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن أراد أن يذكر، أي يخلف أحدهما الآخر في الفضل، والثاني أنه يخلفه فيتدارك فيه ما فات في أحدهما، وذلك لأن العمر مسافة السفر إلى الله، فالناس في هذا العالم سفر، وأول منازلهم المهد وآخرها اللحد، والوطن هو الجنة أو النار، فسنوه مراحله وشهوره فراسخه وأيامه أمياله وأنفاسه خطواته، وطاعته بضاعته، وأوقاته رءوس أمواله، وشهواته وأغراضه قطاع طريقه، وربحه الفوز بلقاء الله تعالى في دار السلام مع الملك الكبير والنعيم المقيم، وخسرانه البعد من الله تعالى مع الأنكال والأغلال والعذاب الأليم في دركات الجحيم، فالغافل في نفس من أنفاسه حتى ينقضي في غير طاعة تقربه إلى الله زلفى متعرض في يوم التغابن لغبينة وحسرة ما لها منتهى، ولهذا الخطر العظيم والخطب الهائل شمر الموفقون عن ساق الجد وودعوا بالكلية ملاذ النفس واغتنموا بقايا العمر ورتبوا بحسب تكرر الأوقات وظائف الأوراد حرصا على إحياء الليل والنهار في طلب القرب من الملك الجبار والسعي إلى دار القرار، فصار من مهمات علم طريق الآخرة تفصيل القول في كيفية قسمة الأوراد وتوزيع العبادات على مقادير الأوقات، لأن الناظرين بنور البصيرة علموا أنه لا نجاة إلا في لقاء الله تعالى، وأنه لا سبيل إلى اللقاء إلا بأن يموت العبد محبا لله تعالى وعارفا بالله سبحانه، وأن المحبة والأنس لا تحصل إلا من دوام ذكر المحبوب والمواظبة عليه، فجعل الله الليل والنهار خلفة ليذكر العبد في كل وقت ما فاته في الآخر، فيتدارك الطاعة ويقرب إلى الله زلفى، وهذا هو الطريق إلى الفوز بلقاء الله في دار السلام.
Indeed, Allah the Exalted has made the night and the day a succession [khilfah] for whoever wills to remember [yadhkara]—meaning one succeeds the other in virtue, and secondly, that it succeeds it so that one may recover in it what was missed in the other. This is because the lifespan [al-'umr] is the distance of the journey [safar] to Allah. Thus, people in this world [al-dunya] are travelers, their first station [manzil] is the cradle and their last is the grave, and the homeland [al-watan] is either Paradise or the Fire. Their year is its stages, its months are its leagues, its days are its miles, and its breaths [anfas] are its steps. His obedience [ta'ah] is his merchandise, and his times [awqat] are his capital. His desires [shahawat] and aims are the highwaymen of his path. His profit [ribh] is success in meeting Allah the Exalted in the Abode of Peace [dar al-salam] with the Great Sovereign [al-Malik al-Kabir] and everlasting bliss [al-na'im al-muqim]. His loss [khusran] is remoteness from Allah the Exalted with shackles, fetters, and painful punishment in the depths of Hell. Therefore, the heedless one [al-ghafil] is, within a single one of his breaths, until it expires in other than an obedience that draws him nearer [yuqarribuhu] to Allah in closeness [zulfa], exposing himself on the Day of Mutual Loss [Yawm al-Taghabun] to a forfeiture and a regret that has no end. Due to this immense peril and tremendous affair, the successful ones [al-muwaffiqun] have rolled up the sleeves of earnest effort [al-jadd] and have completely bid farewell to the comforts of the self [nafs]. They have seized the remnants of the lifespan [al-'umr] and have organized, according to the recurrence of times [awqat], the duties of litanies [awrad], out of eagerness to enliven the night and day in seeking nearness [al-qurb] to the Compelling Sovereign [al-Malik al-Jabbar] and striving toward the Abode of Permanence [dar al-qarar]. Thus, from the important matters of the knowledge of the path [tariq] to the Hereafter [al-akhirah] is the detailed discourse on the manner of dividing the litanies [awrad] and distributing the acts of worship ['ibadat] according to the measures of the times [awqat]. For those who see by the light [nur] of insight [al-basirah] know that there is no salvation [najat] except in meeting Allah the Exalted, and that there is no way [sabil] to the meeting [liqa'] except that the servant ['abd] dies loving Allah the Exalted and knowing [arifan] Allah, glorified is He, and that love [al-mahabbah] and intimacy [al-uns] are not attained except through the continuity of remembrance [dhikr] of the Beloved [al-Mahbub] and perseverance upon it. Therefore, Allah has made the night and day a succession [khilfah] so that the servant may remember in every time [waqt] what he missed in the other, thus recovering the obedience [ta'ah] and drawing nearer [yuqarribu] to Allah in closeness [zulfa]. And this is the path [al-tariq] to success [al-fawz] in meeting Allah in the Abode of Peace [dar al-salam].

a.g: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عطاء بن أبي رباح "يمشون على الأرض هوناً" أي حلماء.
Indeed, regarding the saying of Al-Hasan concerning the Most High's statement, "And when the ignorant [al-jahilun] address them, they say, 'Peace [salam]'" — he said: They are forbearing [hulama']; if ignorance [jahl] is shown to them, they do not act ignorantly.

a.g: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن القلب إذا مال إلى ملاذ الدنيا، وصرف العبد شطر أوقاته في تدبيراتها وشهواتها المباحة، والشطر الآخر في العبادات، رجح جانب الميل إلى الدنيا لموافقة الطبع، إذ يكون الوقت متساوياً، فكيف يتقاومان والطبع لأحدهما مرجح؟ الظاهر والباطن يتساعدان على أمور الدنيا، ويصفو في طلبها القلب ويتجرد، أما الرد إلى العبادات فمتكلف، ولا يسلم إخلاص القلب فيه وحضوره إلا في بعض الأوقات. فمن أراد أن يدخل الجنة بغير حساب، فليستغرق أوقاته في الطاعة، ومن أراد أن تترجح كفة حسناته وتثقل موازين خيراته، فليستوعب في الطاعة أكثر أوقاته. فإن خلط عملاً صالحاً وآخر سيئاً، فأمره مخطر، ولكن الرجاء غير منقطع، والعفو من كرم الله منتظر، فعسى الله تعالى أن يغفر له بجوده وكرمه. فهذا ما انكشف للناظرين بنور البصيرة، فإن لم تكن من أهله، فانظر إلى خطاب الله تعالى لرسوله، واقتبسه بنور الإيمان، فقد قال الله تعالى: ﴿ والذين يبيتون لربهم سجدا وقياما ﴾، فذلك يبين أن الفائزين هم من يبيتون الليل سجداً وقياماً، ملتزمين بالذكر والعبادة، فيحذرون الآخرة ويرجون رحمة ربهم، وهذا يدل على أن الطريق إلى الله تعالى مراقبة الأوقات وعمارتها بالأوراد على سبيل الدوام، ليتدارك في أحدهما ما فات في الآخر، مبتغين فضلاً من ربهم وهو الثواب والمغفرة.
Indeed, the heart [qalb], when it inclines toward the pleasures of the world [dunya], and the servant spends one portion of his time in its arrangements and its permissible appetites, and the other portion in acts of worship, the side of inclination toward the world is weighted due to its conformity with the natural disposition [tab'], for the time is equal. So how can they be balanced when the natural disposition gives weight to one of them? The outward [zahir] and the inward [batin] cooperate in the affairs of the world, and the heart becomes pure and single-minded in seeking it. As for turning back to acts of worship, it is forced, and the sincerity [ikhlas] of the heart and its presence therein is not sound except at some times. So whoever wishes to enter Paradise without reckoning, let him immerse all his times in obedience. And whoever wishes for the scale of his good deeds to be weighted and the balances of his goodness to be heavy, let him occupy most of his time in obedience. For if he mixes a righteous deed with another evil one, his affair is perilous, but hope is not cut off, and pardon from the generosity of Allah is awaited. Perhaps Allah, the Exalted, will forgive him by His bounty and generosity. This is what has been unveiled to the observers by the light of insight [basira]. If you are not of its people, then look to the address of Allah, the Exalted, to His Messenger, and take it by the light of faith [iman], for Allah, the Exalted, has said: **"And those who spend the night for their Lord, prostrating and standing"** [25:64]. That clarifies that the successful ones are those who spend the night prostrating and standing, committed to remembrance [dhikr] and worship, fearing the Hereafter [akhira] and hoping for the mercy of their Lord. This indicates that the path to Allah, the Exalted, is the vigilance over times and filling them with litanies [awrad] on the basis of continuity, so that what is missed in one may be recovered in another, seeking a bounty from their Lord, which is the reward and forgiveness.

a.g: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;
Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."
And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
والمطلوب في صفة الغضب حسن الحمية وذلك بأن يخلو عن التهور وعن الجبن جميعاً. وبالجملة أن يكون في نفسه قوياً ومع قوته منقاداً للعقل. والذي يدل على أن المطلوب هو الوسط في الأخلاق دون الطرفين أن السخاء خلق محمود شرعاً، وهو وسط بين طرفي التبذير والتقتير. وقد أثنى الله تعالى عليه فقال "والذين إذا أنفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما". وكذلك المطلوب في شهوة الطعام الاعتدال دون الشره والجمود قال الله تعالى "وكلوا واشربوا ولا تسرفوا إنه لا يحب المسرفين". وقال في الغضب "أشداء على الكفار رحماء بينهم". وقال ﷺ "خير الأمور أوساطها". وهذا له سر وتحقيق وهو أن السعادة منوطة بسلامة القلب عن عوارض هذا العالم. قال الله تعالى "إلا من أتى الله بقلب سليم" والبخل من عوارض الدنيا، والتبذير أيضاً من عوارض الدنيا، وشرط القلب أن يكون سليماً منهما أي لا يكون ملتفتاً إلى المال ولا يكون حريصاً على إنفاقه ولا على إمساكه، فإن الحريص على الإنفاق مصروف القلب إلى الإنفاق كما أن الحريص على الإمساك مصروف القلب إلى الإمساك فكان كمال القلب أن يصفوا عن الوصفين جميعاً. وإذا لم يكن ذلك في الدنيا طلبنا ما هو الأشبه لعدم الوصفين وأبعد عن الطرفين وهو الوسط، فإن الفاتر لا حار ولا بارد بل هو وسط بينهما فكأنه خال عن الوصفين. فكذلك السخاء بين التبذير والتقتير. والشجاعة بين الجبن والتهور. والعفة بين الشره والجمود. وكذلك سائر الأخلاق فكلا طرفي الأمور ذميم؛ هذا هو المطلوب وهو ممكن.
Indeed, what is required in the attribute of anger [ghadab] is a praiseworthy zeal [hamiyyah], such that it is free from recklessness [tahawwur] and from cowardice [jubn] altogether. In sum, it is that one be strong in his soul [nafs] and, with his strength, submissive to the intellect ['aql]. What indicates that what is required is the middle path [al-wasat] in character traits [akhlaq], not the two extremes, is that generosity [al-sakha'] is a praiseworthy trait in the Sacred Law [shar'], and it is a middle between the two extremes of wastefulness [tabdhir] and stinginess [taqtir]. And Allah, the Exalted, has praised it, saying: "And those who, when they spend, are neither wasteful nor stingy, but maintain a balance between that." Likewise, what is required in the appetite [shahwah] for food is moderation [i'tidal], not gluttony [sharh] nor abstinence [jumud]. Allah, the Exalted, said: "And eat and drink, but do not be wasteful. Indeed, He does not love the wasteful." And He said concerning anger [ghadab]: "Severe against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves." And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "The best of matters are their middle paths." This has a secret [sirr] and a verification [tahqiq], which is that felicity [sa'adah] is tied to the soundness [salamah] of the heart [qalb] from the afflictions ['awarid] of this world [al-dunya]. Allah, the Exalted, said: "Except he who comes to Allah with a sound heart [qalb salim]." And stinginess [bukhl] is from the afflictions of the world [al-dunya], and wastefulness [tabdhir] is also from the afflictions of the world [al-dunya]. And the condition of the heart [qalb] is that it be sound [salim] from both of them, meaning it is not inclined towards wealth [mal], nor is it eager [haris] to spend it nor to withhold it. For the one eager to spend has his heart [qalb] turned towards spending, just as the one eager to withhold has his heart [qalb] turned towards withholding. Thus, the perfection [kamal] of the heart [qalb] is that it be clear [safa] from both descriptions [wasfayn] altogether. And since that is not attainable in the world [al-dunya], we seek what is most similar to the absence of the two descriptions and furthest from the two extremes, which is the middle [al-wasat]. For the lukewarm is neither hot nor cold, but rather a middle between them, as if it is free from both descriptions. So it is with generosity [al-sakha'] between wastefulness [tabdhir] and stinginess [taqtir]. And courage [al-shaja'ah] between cowardice [jubn] and recklessness [tahawwur]. And chastity [al-'iffah] between gluttony [sharh] and abstinence [jumud]. And likewise all other character traits [akhlaq], for both extremes of matters are blameworthy; this is what is required, and it is possible.

a.g: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -
Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.
And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال مجاهد "وإذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما" أي إذا أوذوا صفحوا. وروي أن ابن مسعود مر بلغو معرضاً فقال رسول الله ﷺ "أصبح ابن مسعود وأمسى كريماً" ثم تلا إبراهيم بن ميسرة وهو الراوي قوله تعالى "وإذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما"
Indeed, Mujahid said: "And when they pass by idle talk [al-laghw], they pass by with dignity [karama]" – meaning, when they are wronged, they turn away. And it was narrated that Ibn Mas'ud passed by idle talk [al-laghw] while turning away, so the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Ibn Mas'ud has become, morning and evening, noble [karim]." Then Ibrahim ibn Maysarah, who is the narrator, recited the saying of the Almighty: "And when they pass by idle talk [al-laghw], they pass by with dignity [karama]."

a.g: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى في وصف الرسل ومدحهم (ولقد أرسلنا رسلا من قبلك وجعلنا لهم أزواجا وذرية) فذكر ذلك في معرض الامتنان وإظهار الفضل ومدح أولياءه بسؤال ذلك في الدعاء فقال (والذين يقولون ربنا هب لنا من أزواجنا وذرياتنا قرة أعين) الآية
Indeed, We have sent messengers before you, and We have made for them spouses and offspring [dhurriyya]. And He mentioned this in the context of bestowing favor [imtinan] and manifesting grace [fadl], and in praise of His allies [awliya'] for asking for this in supplication [du'a'], so He said: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our spouses and offspring comfort to our eyes [qurrata a'yun]..." (to the end of the verse).

a.g: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.
Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.
Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent.
